results.title: It’s 50 Degrees in Minneapolis. Goodbye, Ice Shanties.
results.abstract: The Art Shanty Projects opened to crowds 10,000-strong on a frozen lake in Minneapolis. But after the first zany weekend, March-like temperatures set in.

results.title: Joe Rogan Renews at Spotify, but Will No Longer Be Exclusive
results.abstract: The streaming service announced a multiyear agreement that will make “The Joe Rogan Experience” available on YouTube, Apple Podcasts and more.

multimedia.caption: Spotify’s new deal with Joe Rogan is a sign of the changing economics of the podcasting industry as it retreats from its high-flying days.

results.title: ‘Curb Your Enthusiasm’ Made Something Out of Nothing
results.abstract: Larry David’s HBO series never aimed at grand statements. But its reflection of modern grievances was pretty, pretty good.

multimedia.caption: On “Curb,” David has starred as “Larry David,” simultaneously the world’s most comfortable and uncomfortable man.
On “Curb,” David has starred as “Larry David,” simultaneously the world’s most comfortable and uncomfortable man.

results.title: André 3000 Finally Takes the Stage, and There Are No Words
results.abstract: Performing live for the first time with musicians from his solo LP, the onetime Outkast rapper played various flutes, said little and tried to change perceptions.

multimedia.caption: André 3000 onstage at the Blue Note on Wednesday. The rapper has turned to instrumental music, which he debuted in a series of performances this week.

results.title: Susie Essman, the Scene-Stealer Who Makes Larry David Lose It
results.abstract: Ahead of the final season of “Curb Your Enthusiasm,” the comic looked back at playing Susie Greene, a character whose voice was as loud as her outfits.

multimedia.caption: “She’s the funniest hostile character I’ve ever seen on television,” Richard Lewis, a castmate, said of Essman.

results.title: The Point of ‘Saltburn’ Isn’t What You Think It Is
results.abstract: The streaming hit has generated much chatter for its transgressive scenes. But those are diversions, camouflaging what the director is really doing.

results.title: Want to Live Like a Queen? This ‘Crown’ Auction Can Help.
results.abstract: Bonhams is selling hundreds of costumes and props from “The Crown,” including a horse-drawn carriage, robes of state and the queen’s bed.

multimedia.caption: The items from “The Crown” production up for auction include a ball gown, porcelain corgis, a clapper board, a signed script and pieces of furniture.

results.title: Young Filmmaker Lives His ‘Fairy Tale’ at Sundance
results.abstract: Sean Wang, a first-time director, received an audience award for his coming-of-age film, “Dìdi.” He also got the ultimate prize: a distribution deal.

results.title: Plan to Resurface a Pyramid in Granite Draws Heated Debate
results.abstract: A project to restore granite blocks that once covered a greater portion of the Pyramid of Menkaure in Giza has been criticized by some preservationists.

multimedia.caption: The Pyramid of Menkaure was once clad partly in granite blocks, visible in the lower portion. A plan to restore more of them is generating debate.

results.title: From Ballet to Blackjack, a Dance Pioneer’s Amazing Odyssey

results.title: Jesse L. Martin Is Watching You
results.abstract: The classically trained actor taps into his powers of observation to play a behavioral science professor in the NBC series “The Irrational.”

multimedia.caption: The new role has made Jesse L. Martin uncomfortably aware of human behavior. “I feel weird walking around, watching my friends’ behavior, my family’s behavior. But I can’t help it,” he said.

results.title: Crafting an Aboriginal Reality Out of History, Myth, and the Spiritual Realm
results.abstract: Alexis Wright, an Indigenous Australian author, writes epic novels in which many voices clamor to be heard.

multimedia.caption: “We need to be preparing for a brave new world,” said Alexis Wright. She began writing her most recent book, “Praiseworthy,” when thinking about what the future might look like for Aboriginal people.

results.title: The Book Behind ‘American Fiction’ Came Out 23 Years Ago. It’s Still Current.

results.abstract: The actor, who stars with Mandy Patinkin in “Death and Other Details,” says such moments happen “right before you get to that place with somebody, when the pause is no longer as awkward.”

results.title: Alice Mackler, Sculptor Discovered in Her 80s, Dies at 92
results.abstract: Originally a painter, she worked low-level office jobs for most of her life. Later, she started making strange clay figures, and found fame at 81.

multimedia.caption: Alice Mackler at home in New York City in 2021. ︎︎︎Though she only gained notice in old age, she never lacked confidence: “I always knew I was good,” she said.
Alice Mackler at home in New York City in 2021. ︎︎︎Though she only gained notice in old age, she never lacked confidence: “I always knew I was good,” she said.

results.title: Carl Weathers, Who Played Apollo Creed in ‘Rocky’ Movies, Dies at 76
results.abstract: A former pro linebacker, he had a long acting career that reached beyond the boxing ring, appearing in action films, comedies and TV dramas and earning an Emmy nomination.

multimedia.caption: Carl Weathers as Apollo Creed in “Rocky IV” (1985). He was a key part of one of Hollywood’s most successful movie franchises.

results.title: Don Murray, a Star in Films That Took on Social Issues, Dies at 94
results.abstract: An Oscar-nominated role opposite Marilyn Monroe in “Bus Stop” led to a long career in film and TV and onstage, in productions that grappled with race, drugs, homosexuality and more.

multimedia.caption: Don Murray with Marilyn Monroe in the 1956 film “Bus Stop,” which earned him his first and only Academy Award nomination.

results.title: Sandra Milo, Who Had Star Turns in Fellini Films, Dies at 90
results.abstract: She was called Fellini’s muse. She claimed she was his lover. In a long career, she was best known for her performances in his movies “8 ½” and “Juliet of the Spirits.”

multimedia.caption: Ms. Milo in 1966 during the filming of the Italian western “Bang Bang Kid.” With a distinctive voice that often broke into laughter, she cultivated an image as a ditsy blonde, impeccably coifed and made up.
